summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the OIG's draft report on the investigation and review of the BOP's custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The memo provides the draft report for a factual accuracy and sensitivity review and sets a deadline for the BOP's response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the subject of the OIG's draft report investigating the Federal Bureau of Prisons' custody, care, and supervision of him at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Deadline for BOP Review and Response
events.description: The deadline set by the OIG for the Federal Bureau of Prisons to complete its factual accuracy and sensitivity review of the draft report and to submit any formal response.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, New York
keyFacts: The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) has prepared a draft report investigating the Federal Bureau of Prisons' (BOP) handling of Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody.
The BOP is instructed to conduct a factual accuracy and sensitivity review of the draft report and may submit a formal response, which will be included as an appendix in the final public report.
The BOP must maintain strict confidentiality of the draft report, log access to it, and prohibit its dissemination outside of necessary BOP employees involved in the review.
The final report is intended for public release on the OIG's website.
